title: Ditch Chemicals: Natural Ayurvedic Oral Care
author: Harish
excerpt: Explore how neem and turmeric can transform your oral care routine with natural antimicrobial and anti-inflammatory benefits.
content:
Why Ayurveda Prefers Herbal Tooth Powders

Before chemical toothpaste existed, Ayurveda relied on herbal powders made from neem, turmeric, clove, and natural minerals. These ingredients cleanse the mouth, strengthen gums, and maintain fresh breath without synthetic foaming agents.

Key Herbs That Support Oral Health

  • Neem: Powerful antimicrobial for gum health.
  • Turmeric: Reduces inflammation and soothes gums.
  • Clove: Strengthens gums and reduces sensitivity.

How to Use Ayurvedic Tooth Powder

  1. Wet your brush.
  2. Dip gently — a little goes a long way.
  3. Brush for 1–2 minutes.
  4. Rinse thoroughly.

Use 2–3 times weekly to avoid abrasiveness.

Safety Notes

Ayurvedic powders are not meant to be swallowed. People with enamel thinning or gum disease should consult a dentist before switching entirely to powders.
